ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: An experience not to be missed. The second half of Studies in Grand Strategy is the only chance you will have at Yale to build teamwork, administrative leadership, and critical thinking of present-day issues in politics and international relations that are mandatory for success in the highest positions of power in American government and elsewhere. Take advantage of the out-of-class dinners and really pour yourself into the summer experience to get the most out of the class and to get to know your amazing classmates.
yes. It's fun. It should be two credits though, or 1.5. I wrote a 28 pg paper, did two 2hour in class presentations, and spent 7:30am-5pm two consecutive Saturdays on this course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
